intro: Serapias laxiflora var. parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered serapias, is a member of the Primulaceae family. It is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe, particularly found in rocky or limestone soils. The plant produces striking, yellow-orange flowers with five petals, often with a distinctive hooded shape. It thrives in sunny, well-drained environments and is often found in alpine or subalpine regions. Its unique floral structure and habitat preferences make it a notable species in botanical studies.
